wizard.title: Setup Wizard
wizard.description: Configure your Maestro environment in a few simple steps
wizard.helpText: This wizard will help you set up your environment in just a few steps. You can configure your Claude OAuth token, set up memory features, and create your first task.

welcome.title: Welcome to Maestro
welcome.subtitle: Orchestrate software development with AI-powered agents

aiPowered.title: AI-Powered Development
aiPowered.description: Generate code and build features using Claude Code agents

specDriven.title: Spec-Driven Workflow
specDriven.description: Define tasks with clear specifications and let Maestro handle the implementation

memory.title: Memory & Context
memory.description: Persistent memory across sessions with Graphiti

parallel.title: Parallel Execution
parallel.description: Run multiple agents in parallel for faster development cycles

oauth.title: Claude Authentication
oauth.description: Connect your Claude account to enable AI features
oauth.keychainDescription: Your tokens are encrypted using your system's keychain. You may see a password prompt from macOS — click "Always Allow" to avoid seeing it again.

memory.title: Memory
memory.description: Maestro Memory helps remember context across your coding sessions

completion.title: You're All Set!
completion.subtitle: Maestro is ready to help you build amazing software
completion.setupCompleteDescription: Your environment is configured and ready. You can start creating tasks immediately or explore the application at your own pace.

createTask.title: Create a Task
createTask.description: Start by creating your first task to see Maestro in action.

customizeSettings.title: Customize Settings
customizeSettings.description: Fine-tune your preferences, configure integrations, or re-run this wizard.

exploreDocs.title: Explore Documentation
exploreDocs.description: Learn more about advanced features, best practices, and troubleshooting.

completion.rerunHint: You can always re-run this wizard from Settings → Application

devtools.description: Choose your preferred IDE and terminal for working with Maestro worktrees
devtools.whyConfigureDescription: When Maestro builds features in isolated worktrees, you can open them directly in your preferred IDE or terminal to test and review changes.

ide.label: Preferred IDE
ide.description: Maestro will open worktrees in this editor

terminal.label: Preferred Terminal
terminal.description: Maestro will open terminal sessions here
